Detailed Description

Helper functions to abstract SFP and QSFP connectors.

Revision
146313

Define Documentation

#define CVMX_SFP_DEFAULT_DIAG_I2C_ADDR   0x51

Default address of SFP diagnostics chip.

#define CVMX_SFP_DEFAULT_I2C_ADDR   0x50

Default address of sfp EEPROM.

#define CVMX_SFP_MAX_EEPROM_SIZE   0x100

Maximum size for the SFP EEPROM.

Currently only 96 bytes are used.

enum cvmx_phy_sfp_conn_type

Connector type for module, usually we only see SFP and QSFPP.

Enumerator:
CVMX_SFP_CONN_SFP 
CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFP 

SFP/SFP+/SFP28.

CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFPP 

1G QSFP (obsolete)

CVMX_SFP_CONN_QSFP28 

QSFP+ or later.

CVMX_SFP_CONN_MICRO_QSFP 

QSFP28 (100Gbps).

enum cvmx_phy_sfp_mod_type

module type plugged into a SFP/SFP+/QSFP+ port

Enumerator:
CVMX_SFP_MOD_UNKNOWN 
CVMX_SFP_MOD_OPTICAL_LC 

Unknown or unspecified.

Fiber optic module (LC connector)

CVMX_SFP_MOD_OPTICAL_PIGTAIL 

Fiber optic module (pigtail, no connector).

CVMX_SFP_MOD_COPPER_PIGTAIL 
CVMX_SFP_MOD_RJ45 

copper module

CVMX_SFP_MOD_NO_SEP_CONN 

RJ45 (i.e.

10GBase-T) No separable connector (SFP28/copper)

CVMX_SFP_MOD_OTHER 

Unknown/other module type.

enum cvmx_phy_sfp_rate

Peak rate supported by SFP cable.

Enumerator:
CVMX_SFP_RATE_UNKNOWN 
CVMX_SFP_RATE_1G 

Unknown rate.

CVMX_SFP_RATE_10G 

1Gbps

CVMX_SFP_RATE_25G 

10Gbps

CVMX_SFP_RATE_40G 

25Gbps

CVMX_SFP_RATE_100G 

40Gbps

100Gbps

Function Documentation

int cvmx_phy_sfp_parse_eeprom ( struct cvmx_sfp_mod_info *  sfp_info,
const uint8_t *  buffer 
)

Reads the SFP/SFP+/QSFP EEPROM and outputs the type of module or cable plugged in.

Parameters:
[out] sfp_info Info about SFP module
[in] buffer SFP EEPROM buffer to parse
Returns:
0 on success, -1 if error reading EEPROM or if EEPROM corrupt
void cvmx_phy_sfp_print_info ( const struct cvmx_sfp_mod_info *  sfp_info  ) 

Prints out information about a SFP/QSFP device.

Parameters:
[in] sfp_info data structure to print
int cvmx_phy_sfp_read_i2c_eeprom ( uint8_t *  buffer,
int  i2c_bus,
int  i2c_addr 
)

Reads the SFP EEPROM using the i2c bus.

Parameters:
[out] buffer Buffer to store SFP EEPROM data in The buffer should be SFP_MAX_EEPROM_SIZE bytes.
i2c_bus i2c bus number to read from for SFP port
i2c_addr i2c address to use, 0 for default
Returns:
-1 if invalid bus or i2c read error, 0 for success
int cvmx_sfp_check_mod_abs ( struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *  sfp,
void *  data 
)

Function called to check and return the status of the mod_abs pin or mod_pres pin for QSFPs.

Parameters:
sfp Handle to SFP information.
data User-defined data passed to the function
Returns:
0 if absent, 1 if present, -1 on error

Given a fdt node offset find the corresponding SFP or QSFP slot.

Parameters:
of_offset flat device tree node offset
Returns:
pointer to SFP data structure or NULL if not found

Returns:
pointer to SFP data structure or NULL if not found

Returns:
0 for success, -1 on error

int cvmx_sfp_register_check_mod_abs ( struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *  sfp,
int(*)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, void *data)  check_mod_abs,
void *  mod_abs_data 
)

Registers a function to be called to check mod_abs/mod_pres for a SFP/QSFP slot.

Parameters:
sfp Handle to SFP data structure
check_mod_abs Function to be called or NULL to remove
mod_abs_data User-defined data to be passed to check_mod_abs
Returns:
0 for success

For walking list

int cvmx_sfp_register_mod_abs_changed ( struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *  sfp,
int(*)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, int val, void *data)  mod_abs_changed,
void *  mod_abs_changed_data 
)

Registers a function to be called whenever the mod_abs/mod_pres signal changes.

Parameters:
sfp Handle to SFP data structure
mod_abs_changed Function called whenever mod_abs is changed or NULL to remove.
mod_abs_changed_data User-defined data passed to mod_abs_changed
Returns:
0 for success
Parameters:
sfp Handle to SFP data structure
mod_abs_changed Function called whenever mod_abs is changed or NULL to remove.
mod_abs_changed_data User-defined data passed to mod_abs_changed
Returns:
0 for success

: If multiple SFP slots are linked together, all subsequent slots will also be registered for the same handler.

int cvmx_sfp_register_rx_los_changed ( struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *  sfp,
int(*)(struct cvmx_fdt_sfp_info *sfp, int val, void *data)  rx_los_changed,
void *  rx_los_changed_data 
)

Registers a function to be called whenever rx_los changes.

Parameters:
sfp Handle to SFP data structure
rx_los_changed Function to be called when rx_los changes or NULL to remove the function
rx_los_changed_data User-defined data passed to rx_los_changed
Returns:
0 for success
